definition: to impose, involve, or imply as a necessary accompaniment or result
examples: the project will entail considerable expense

definition: to restrict (property) by limiting the inheritance to the owner's lineal descendants or to a particular class thereof
to confer, assign, or transmit (something) for an indefinitely long time : to confer, assign, or transmit as if by entail
to fix (a person) permanently in some condition or status
examples: entail him and his heirs unto the crown

definition: a restriction especially of lands by limiting the inheritance to the owner's lineal descendants or to a particular class thereof
an entailed (see entail entry 1 sense 2) estate
something transmitted as if by entail
